channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Matthew Perry’s Assistant and Doctors Charged With Getting Him Ketamine
item.description: The authorities charged Mr. Perry’s personal assistant, two doctors and others with crimes, including conspiracy to distribute ketamine, in the death of the former “Friends” star.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Gaza Cease-Fire Negotiators Meet Amid Threat of Wider Conflict
item.description: Hamas said it wouldn’t participate in the meeting, dimming hopes for a breakthrough to end Israel’s war against the armed group.

item.title: Rich people are going to Walmart more—and they’re a key reason for the company’s recent success
item.description: CEO Doug McMillon told analysts upper-income shoppers account for most of Walmart’s sales gains.

item.title: Ukraine Claims to Capture Russian Town, Pressing Assault With Airfield Strikes
item.description: The fall of Sudzha, about six miles from the border, would be Ukraine’s first capture of a Russian town since its troops crossed into Russian territory 10 days ago.

item.title: Macron Honors African Soldiers Who Helped Liberate France in World War II
item.description: Two months after D-Day, an Allied force dominated by soldiers conscripted from French colonies swept into southern France. It’s a chapter of its history that France has long obscured.

item.title: Fellow Gen Xers: That retirement crisis you’re losing sleep over is a ‘rewirement’ opportunity
item.description: Rather than retire after corporate life, Anne Chow decided to “rewire,” completely reimagining her life’s next chapter.

item.title: U.S. Announces Prices for First Drugs Picked for Medicare Negotiations
item.description: The Biden administration said it would have saved $6 billion had the new prices been in effect last year.

item.title: Ukraine Claims to Capture Russian Town, Pressing Assault With Airfield Strikes
item.description: The fall of Sudzha, about six miles from the border, would be Ukraine’s first capture of a Russian town since its troops crossed into Russian territory 10 days ago.

item.title: What is ketamine? Potential dangers of the drug responsible for ‘Friends’ star Matthew Perry’s death
item.description: Ketamine, popularly known as the party drug Special K, has recently been hailed as a breakthrough treatment for major depression, but it's not without risks.

item.title: Taylor Swift to Return to Stage for Eras Tour in London
item.description: Fans gathering at Wembley Stadium in London said they trusted British security officials to keep them safe.

item.title: Ukraine’s Incursion Into Russia Reveals a Dramatic Shift
item.description: The offensive was developed in secret, devised to divert Russian troops away from the front lines in Ukraine and seize territory to use as a bargaining chip.

item.title: Goldman Sachs’ CEO was rejected twice by the firm. He’s since led it to over $50 billion in revenue
item.description: You’re less likely to get hired at Goldman Sachs than accepted into Harvard.

item.title: Gena Rowlands, Actress in ’The Notebook’, Dies at 94
item.description: Known for playing on-the-verge characters, she twice earned Oscar nominations for her work in films directed by John Cassavetes, her husband.

item.title: Russia Sentences U.S. Citizen to 12 Years in Prison on Treason Charges
item.description: Ksenia Karelina is accused of donating $52 to a New York-based nonprofit that sends assistance to Ukraine.

item.title: Toxic metals found in tampons have set off alarm bells—the kind I responded to 35 years ago when starting my company
item.description: Regulators should demand greater transparency in period care products, says Natracare founder and CEO Susie Hewson.
